block.p: Nigerian Court Faults Exclusion of Candidate Nigeria's highest court ruled that electoral officials had illegally excluded a top opposition candidate for president, Atiku Abubakar, from the ballot for the presidential election on Saturday. The ruling throws the already chaotic election season in Africa's most populous nation into deeper turmoil.
PAGE A8

Donating Early and Often The American public has given about $160 million to the 2008 presidential candidates so far this year, more than five times the total contributed to campaigns in the same period four years ago.
PAGE A24
Almost Human Scientists are seeing increasing evidence of similarities between chimpanzees and humans, and there is just a 1.23 percent difference in their genes.
SCIENCE TIMES, PAGE F1

Sudan to Allow U.N. in Darfur Sudan has dropped its objections to large-scale United Nations assistance to the overwhelmed African Union peacekeeping force in Darfur, setting the stage for the possible assignment there of United Nations peacekeepers.
PAGE A6

First, Not Fast, in Boston Robert K. Cheruiyot of Kenya and Lidiya Grigoryeva of Russia overcame the remnants of a northeaster to win the 111th running of the Boston Marathon. The winning times were the slowest in more than two decades.
SPORTSTUESDAY, PAGE D1

Museum Makes Show of Itself In a new exhibition, the Guggenheim Museum puts the focus on its corroding facade. Officials spent the last year inspecting each crack and devising a repair plan. The show, ''Restoring a Masterpiece,'' examines that process.
THE ARTS, PAGE E1

Routed by a Record Storm Jay Hernandez, right, of the Police Emergency Unit in Yonkers, guided a boat down a flooded street after evacuating a woman and her two grandsons. The northeaster of '07 was blamed for at least nine deaths in five states. Damage is expected to total in the hundreds of millions of dollars.
PAGE B1

Pulitzers Are Awarded The Wall Street Journal won two Pulitzer Prizes, for public service and international reporting, and The New York Times won for feature writing. Special citations were announced for Ray Bradbury and John Coltrane.
PAGE B8

Green Move at Home Depot Home Depot is taking steps to encourage sales of items that meet standards for being safe for the environment with a new label called Eco Options on about 3,000 of its products.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1
Student Lender to Be Bought Sallie Mae, the student loan provider, agreed to be taken over by two private equity companies and two banks for $25 billion.
